description: One (1) Intermediate Procurement Specialist as part of Project Management Services. The contract is for 2 years, with an option to extend 3 one-year periods.
duration_in_months: It's 2 years, with an option to extend 3 one-year periods.
full_summary:
**Intermediate Procurement Specialist**
**Request for Proposal**

**Reference Number:** PW-22-01012566
**Amendment Number:** 3
**Solicitation Number:** W8486-238747/A
**Publication Date:** November 4, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** December 13, 2022, 2:00 p.m.

**Introduction**
The Department of National Defence is seeking proposals from pre-qualified suppliers for the services of one (1) Intermediate Procurement Specialist under Stream 3, Project Management Services. This contract will be awarded for an initial term of two (2) years, with the option to extend by up to three (3) one-year irrevocable option periods.

**Eligible Suppliers**
This requirement is open to pre-qualified suppliers listed in the Task and Solutions Professional Service (TSPS) Supply Arrangement (SA) number E60ZT-18TSPS. A complete list of eligible suppliers is provided in the attached documentation.

**Key Requirements**

* Provide Intermediate Procurement Specialist services to the Department of National Defence
* Services must meet the requirements of Stream 3, Project Management Services
* Initial contract term is two (2) years, with the option to extend by up to three (3) one-year irrevocable option periods

**Security Requirements**

* Supplier Security Clearance: Secret
* Security Level required (Document Safeguarding): None

**Location of Work**

* Region: National Capital Region
* Specific Location: 975 St. Joseph Blvd., Gatineau, Quebec

**Bidders' Inquiries**

Inquiries regarding this Request for Proposal must be submitted to the Contracting Authority:

* Name: Iain FitzGerald
* Email: iain.fitzgerald@forces.gc.ca

**Additional Information**

* The work has not been recently performed under another contract.
* There is no incumbent for this position.
* Additional information on personnel and organization security screening or security clauses can be found on the Industrial Security Program (ISP) of Public Works and Government Services Canada website.

Please note that this procurement is subject to the policies and directives of the Treasury Board regarding contracts awarded to former public servants. Bidders must provide the required information as detailed in article 2.3 of Part 2 of the bid solicitation to comply with these policies and directives. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
